publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-413# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Scottish Scallop Industry—That the Parliament notes the progress achieved by the Irish Government in alleviating the problems for its scallop industry associated with amnesic shellfish poisoning, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to take similar measures to remove Scotland’s scallop industry from its present crisis by lifting the current closures under the Food and Environment Protection Act 1985 and focusing the management regime on end product testing without delay. Supported by: Bill Aitken*, Alex Johnstone*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Mary Scanlon*, Mr Murray Tosh*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr John Munro*
S1M-413# Scottish Scallop Industry (lodged on 12 January 2000) Dr Winnie Ewing*, Mr David Davidson*, Fergus Ewing*, Mr Jamie Stone*

S1M-413# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Scottish Scallop Industry—That the Parliament notes the progress achieved by the Irish Government in alleviating the problems for its scallop industry associated with amnesic shellfish poisoning, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to take similar measures to remove Scotland’s scallop industry from its present crisis by lifting the current closures under the Food and Environment Protection Act 1985 and focusing the management regime on end product testing without delay. Supported by: Bill Aitken, Alex Johnstone, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Mary Scanlon, Mr Murray Tosh, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr John Munro, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Fergus Ewing, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr Keith Harding*, Nick Johnston*
S1M-413# Scottish Scallop Industry (lodged on 12 January 2000) David McLetchie*
S1M-413# Scottish Scallop Industry (lodged on 12 January 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, George Lyon*, David Mundell*
S1M-413# Scottish Scallop Industry (lodged on 12 January 2000) Alex Fergusson*
S1M-413# Scottish Scallop Industry (lodged on 12 January 2000) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-413# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Scottish Scallop Industry—That the Parliament notes the progress achieved by the Irish Government in alleviating the problems for its scallop industry associated with amnesic shellfish poisoning, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to take similar measures to remove Scotland’s scallop industry from its present crisis by lifting the current closures under the Food and Environment Protection Act 1985 and focusing the management regime on end product testing without delay. Supported by: Bill Aitken, Alex Johnstone, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Mary Scanlon, Mr Murray Tosh, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr John Munro, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Fergus Ewing, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr Keith Harding, Nick Johnston, David McLetchie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, George Lyon, David Mundell, Alex Fergusson, Donald Gorrie
S1M-413# Scottish Scallop Industry (lodged on 12 January 2000) Christine Grahame*

S1M-413# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Scottish Scallop Industry—That the Parliament notes the progress achieved by the Irish Government in alleviating the problems for its scallop industry associated with amnesic shellfish poisoning, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to take similar measures to remove Scotland’s scallop industry from its present crisis by lifting the current closures under the Food and Environment Protection Act 1985 and focusing the management regime on end product testing without delay. Supported by: Bill Aitken, Alex Johnstone, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Mary Scanlon, Mr Murray Tosh, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr John Munro, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Fergus Ewing, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr Keith Harding, Nick Johnston, David McLetchie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, George Lyon, David Mundell, Alex Fergusson, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame
S1M-413# Scottish Scallop Industry (lodged on 12 January 2000) Brian Adam*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Ben Wallace*

S1M-413# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Scottish Scallop Industry—That the Parliament notes the progress achieved by the Irish Government in alleviating the problems for its scallop industry associated with amnesic shellfish poisoning, and recommends that similar measures be considered to remove Scotland’s scallop industry from its present crisis by lifting the current closures under the Food and Environment Protection Act 1985 and focusing the management regime on end product testing without delay. Supported by: Bill Aitken, Alex Johnstone, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Brian Monteith, Mary Scanlon, Mr Murray Tosh, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr John Munro, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Fergus Ewing, Mr Jamie Stone, Mr Keith Harding, Nick Johnston, David McLetchie, Mr Lloyd Quinan, George Lyon, David Mundell, Alex Fergusson, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame, Brian Adam, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Ben Wallace
S1M-413# Scottish Scallop Industry (lodged on 12 January 2000) Richard Lochhead*
